Description: Body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos. Satyr on left (his head remains) and maenad on the right, facing left, head turned back, (preserved above the knees) with krotala; added red for her himation; her flesh was not painted white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Manner of the Haimon Painter; connected to the workshop of the Haimon Painter by the narrow shape of the vessel (see, for example, Agora 23: 47) and the style of the drawing (compare, for example, for the proportions of the figures Tübingen 7352 [CVA Germany 47: pl. 50 figs. 7-9], attributed to the Haimon Group; compare also Athens, Agora P 24516 [Agora 23: pl. 87 no. 1185], perhaps by the Haimon Painter).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 81 no. 273 pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1921)
